document.title: WISCONSIN STANDARDS FOR Family and Consumer Sciences

EBE5A7918FD5465085B0E85461ACCF72.description:

monitor and evaluate risk
management practices.

variety of legal

Demonstrate knowledge

proper scaling and

variety of cooking
methods, including
roasting, broiling,
smoking, grilling, sautéing,

poaching, steaming, and
baking.

pan frying, deep frying,

steaming, and baking.

knife safety and other
safety steps around sharp

industry.

B1CA8E307933407FA746D050547007CC.description:

professional food preparation

variety of food products that meet

5938E26F24A149A2AB019243C36C1686.description:
Record
performance of menu items
to analyze sales and
determine menu revisions.

C50B724107114E1B83EB574F36BF1077.description:
Apply
principles of measurement,

Apply
menu-planning principles to

Develop a variety of
menu layouts, themes,
and design styles.

DCFDF4EBDB0349218E2010CE7A7BC39A.description:

production requirements.

7BCBDB5A38C04C2C84F29762356E7D40.description:

and modify restaurant
menus according to
principles of menu
planning.

982D1330501844719BAB2604999B34D7.description:

influence the success of a
menu item.

5A5A78A84579442F91A39DA7E5DF8104.description:

required documents for
purchasing food and
supplies.

49D60DE9AB6343A98352D9A68DA0BC75.description:

planning principles and techniques

C104CBA07ABA489BBBB1AABACB37A5D3.description:

equipment purchases based
on long-term business
needs, specific regulations,

96AE1FFEFDD643F1B28D6AAA466C3176.description:
Demonstrate procedures
for cleaning and sanitizing
equipment, serving dishes,
glassware, and utensils to

and OSHA requirements.

5F0EB600534940928268EC08983C0EF5.description:

maintain, and store tools
and equipment following
safety procedures and
industry standards.

1F93DEC36DA1486EBDCA1C8E9A961F84.description:
Prioritize equipment
needs based on long-term
business planning.

76F142B7BF014AAAB8E35FA3236BC5EF.description:
Demonstrate how to
properly wash and
sanitize dishes and
cooking surfaces.

F71EAB7F05C94BBE8F6C3DE7F644ADF5.description:
Demonstrate proper
usage and storage of
common cooking tools
and equipment.

A8EE38F09A434BBFBC50AF5227DB7F93.description:
Describe how to wash and
dry dishes.

4F5B5BB0BC884F938969A7BAF8E41454.description:
Identify
common cooking tools and
equipment.

6E8FFC5472624848BAA53F4B2ADFB53D.description:
Demonstrate
industry standards in selecting,
using, and maintaining food
production and food service
equipment.

4794F4ED2B114C1C9D1666FB109CCF15.description:
Demonstrate the ability to
maintain necessary records
to document time and
temperature control,
hazard analysis critical
control point (HACCP),

maintenance of equipment,
and other elements of food
preparation, storage, and
presentation.

4E42E60A1FDF432E8770005D77CC78FB.description:
Use
Occupational Safety and
Health Administration
(OSHA)’s Right to Know
Law and Material Safety
Data Sheets (MSDS), and
explain their requirements
in safe handling and storage
of hazardous materials.

7FEAC3F3C2FF4A4895BD24F8A42A0882.description:
Demonstrate safe food
handling and preparation
techniques that prevent
cross contamination and
cross contact from
potentially hazardous
foods.

D929EA081F224D92970CC49FF7D29DEA.description:
Demonstrate proper
purchasing, receiving,
storage, and handling of
both raw and prepared

1B32E17180884040A39775728FDA4F43.description:
Evaluate
systems utilized in food
service establishments for
reporting employee illness.

FABD27EE2A5B41C88159B933C1500AAE.description:
Use the
Hazard analysis critical
control point (HACCP) and
crisis management
principles and procedures
during food handling
processes to minimize the
risks of foodborne illnesses.

0D9C27824E3446C59FD3A572A602B157.description:
Use food
allergy knowledge for
investigating, researching,
and preparing allergen-free
food.

2AD5B2D286744CEB803A35E486B54883.description:
Use
knowledge of systems for
documenting, investigating,
reporting, and preventing
foodborne illnesses.

C0AB6CEB3C6F4180A495AB8A5C759FBC.description:
Employ
food service management
safety/sanitation program
procedures, including CPR
and first aid.

154E1DCD90FE487890CAB164D506E78B.description:
Identify
characteristics of major
foodborne pathogens, their
role in causing illnesses,

and methods of prevention.

EC3BF029F9754514A25207DBFCA790F6.description:
Demonstrate safe and
environmentally
responsible waste
disposal and recycling
methods.

B99BA86662AB4F0AB828B17F06CB6BE6.description:
Analyze
current types of various
cleaning materials and
sanitizers for proper use
and safety hazards.

7121853CCA2A4AD8A81EBE441D739DF0.description:
Explain
how to prevent cross
contamination and cross
contact when preparing
raw and ready-to-eat
foods.

33957983089C4DFE99E2CB8A46742233.description:
Verify
proper purchasing,
receiving, storage, and
handling of both raw and
prepared foods through

652069A4DDA24694A01049AEB1A9A9C6.description:
Practice standard
personal hygiene and

required for jobs in food
service.

23AFFA8A615D4571AC7B6205A4FA607C.description:
Identify
the types of equipment
needed to properly store
refrigerated, frozen, and

F3FB3B194BDC4181A766D4804878E724.description:
Identify
signs and symptoms
associated with a food
allergy reaction.

C77EB5C1AEC048F0B64FB60628D4FBA1.description:

Describe how proper
hygiene prevents the

77F3D54A9F34406888D3A1683C0AC1D6.description:
Categorize items that are

501F24E57440494FB07A0D6A98104B14.description:

1B536D6176A24DA09759C7EACEEBE99E.description:

231706FDD244487083A842CD624CD51A.description:
Identify

of foodborne illnesses.

50BEE7C6D67F423386327B209C7DD5BB.description:
Simulate
a call for help if someone is
hurt.

057E426C1FA249BA87A71AC578AACFBA.description:
Demonstrate food
safety and sanitation procedures.

21E0C6D7D40941438B7C2A1596A38C3B.description:
Analyze
the role of professional
organizations in food
production and services.

9867E223B661474DB05D62CBDEA24003.description:

employment portfolio to

internships and work-based
learning opportunities.

4196E04F92994A34B372D65CA75459D6.description:

5FE6C219C2294E4E970CEEF24E56EC18.description:

Explore
the role of professional
organizations in food
production and services.

1F1FD042611B45979C156EA2134F867F.description:
Demonstrate skills
needed to be successful in

F1CDB14123CC4BC7A82A5C086C60839B.description:
Analyze opportunities for

BF9AF8EEED0E43CCA86E2D439656C2AC.description:

Identify
professional organizations

8EFF72FC00D2478C84BD4A30C360423E.description:
Analyze career
paths within the food production
and food services industries.

78DA7818E4734A1AB01B2DF93F08E4F9.description:
Students will integrate knowledge, skills, and practices required for careers in food production and
services.
